reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Very disappointed with this hotel. Only reason it should be 4 star is for the location (which is fantastic) and the Staff (very helpful). Apart from that, cannot understand how this comes under a 4 star banner. When the taxi dropped us off at the reception we though we had arrived at the wrong hotel it was so dark and dismal. We paid for a superior double room......bedside lamp fixture broken (even after maintenance came to room), one of the ceiling lights flashing on and off for no particular reason at no particular time, hairdryer not working, no bottle opener for minibar. We pre-booked breakfast for 3 mornings but first two mornings not enough tables set out for clients so had to find our own table in bar area. Third morning decided it was easier and more enjoyable to eat out. Would recommend Madrid to everyone, just not this hotel.

reviews.title: Superb location, great value!
reviews.text: I stayed in Ada Palace for 4 nights in Aug'13. The location is superb, right on Gran Via- one of the busiest avenues in Madrid. The room was quite airy, comfortable to stay for a long period. It was very well decorated, the bathroom is a lot bigger than expected. If you like walking, you don't need to use a cab or the subway. All major landmarks like Edificio de Correos, Parque del Retiro, Plaza Mayor, Callao, Puerta del Sol and the art triangle (Museo Thyssen Bornemizsa, Reina Sophia, Museo del Prado) are located max. within 1 km. Also Calle Fuencarral- where madrileños mostly hang out in cool bars and restaurants-is 100 mts away from the hotel. The hotel's terrace has a lovely view of Circulo de Bellas Artes and Metropolis building right across Gran Via, definitely should pay a visit for a drink and chill after a busy day.

reviews.text: I will definitely stay here for my next visit to Madrid and i strongly recommend to couples and families to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ada Palace is very centrally located and has good size rooms however the bathroom needed maintenance and cleaning. The restaurant was pretty average and some of the staff unhelpful although the front desk staff were excellent. The rooftop bar is very good and equally expensive, 15 Euros for a gin and tonic! The internal layout of the hotel is very cramped and slightly odd especially around the tiny elevators.
reviews.title: Great position but slightly odd.

reviews.text: Centrally located hotel with very helpful staff. Rooms are a good size but very chintzy. The bathroom needed a bit of maintenance in our room. Nice roof terrace where you can have breakfast. Ok for an overnight stop.
reviews.title: Fine for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located for seeing the sights of Madrid. I was very impressed by the reception staff who were friendly and helpful. They gave us a complimentary room upgrade which was a nice surprise. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet. Often people are put off staying in central locations due to noise, that need not be a concern in this hotel. The breakfast was very good and you can either sit on a terrace or inside which ever your preference is. I would definitely recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Good Location and nice staff

reviews.text: This hotel is in a very central location on Gran Via, opposite the Metropolis building and a short walk to the Prada Museum, El Retiro Park and Puerta del Sol. The superior rooms are a very good size and our room overlooked the Metropolis building. The soundproofing is incredible. You will sleep very well in this hotel. The staff are very friendly and breakfast is your typical spread, with both hot and cold items on offer. We loved our time here at this hotel and it would be our choice to book this hotel again when we are next in Madrid. Highly recommended. We stayed here with a one year old and had plenty of room for our port-a-cot.
reviews.title: Excellent location, quiet and clean rooms, will stay here again

reviews.text: The hotel was exceptionally good, lovely big room, food in the hotel excellent.
reviews.title: My first visit to Madrid.

reviews.text: Overall, I really liked this hotel. My only 1 real complaint is the cost of Wifi - 16,95 euro for 24 hours, for up to 2 devices. This is THE most expensive hotel Wifi that I have ever encountered. I think it is ridiculous to charge this much, especially when they then restrict it to only 2 devices. I was travelling by myself, so I only had 2 devices, but if I was travelling with my husband, this could be a reason not to choose this hotel. The Wifi was very good and didn't drop off, so I guess that is something. I do think that the hotel needs to rethink their pricing on this. This is the 21th century and Wifi is necessary, not a luxury item.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the center of Madrid - expensive Wifi

reviews.title: Once was enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very central, which makes it easy to get anywhere you need to be in the city - either on foot or using transit. The Banco de Espana Metro station is just around the corner, and Seville and Gran Via stations are also very close. The Recoletos Cercanias station is only a 5-10 minute walk. Normally I like to choose hotels that aren't quite this central (not so much traffic RIGHT outside), but this was fine. It is on the edge of quieter neighborhoods, so if you turn left out of the hotel lobby instead of right, you are on quiet streets immediately.
reviews.title: 4* perhaps but only just

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was small, but well laid out and very comfortable. The bed was comfortable, the closet adequate (could use more hangers), I had a nice desk and work area. The bathroom was large and very nice - everything worked well, it was well decorated, etc. I did have trouble getting the shower doors to close right - no amount of fiddling with the doors would get them to match up and seal, so I did get lots of water on the floor. It all went into the corner though, so it wasn't a big deal. There wasn't an iron and ironing board in the room, which I thought was odd for a hotel that clearly caters to business travelers.
reviews.title: Won't be back!

reviews.text: At first I was disappointed with the location of my room - facing the interior courtyard rather than out toward the city, but it turned out to be a good thing because my room was very quiet, even with the window open.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, nice people but internet did not work for the most part

reviews.text: When we checked in the reception area was smaller than most and the lifts for two or three at a squeeze. However the rest of the hotel was all wow. Room was excellent and placed at the top of the hotel on the corner overlooking the street below. Very quiet and dinning on the roof top an experience to behold. All staff inter action were beyond our expectations and we greatly enjoyed our stay with the breakfast a must for all.
reviews.title: Roof top experience in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by the size of both bedroom and bathroom given the city centre location of this hotel. The bed was huge, probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Best of all the room was quiet, amazing in the centre of Madrid. The hotel is a short walk from Plaza Cibeles where the airport bus stops, making the journey from the airport only 5 euros per person. All the major attractions are within easy walking distance. There is a roof top terrace where you can enjoy a drink or even a meal, looking out over the city. Staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was also good, plenty of fresh fruit and fresh pastries, with only one minor complaint - all the sachets for the nexpresso machine were strong blends, too much for me at breakfast time. They do charge for wi-fi but as we didn't want to use it that was no problem. The lifts are tiny holding only 4 people or 2 with suitcases, maybe a nuisance for the impatient but no problem otherwise. Would throughly recommend this hotel for those on a citybreak.
reviews.title: A quiet oasis in a noisy city
